newsitem.title: USA: Mrs Clinton still plans to go on Africa trip.
newsitem.headline: Mrs Clinton still plans to go on Africa trip.

text.p: Hillary Rodham Clinton still plans to go on a two-week tour of Africa but her scheduled departure on Saturday could be delayed because of President Bill Clinton's leg injury, an aide said on Friday.
"We're still going," said a spokesman for the first lady, Neel Lattimore.

He said Mrs. Clinton wanted to see the severity of her husband's injury before deciding when to leave. The president will have surgery on Friday to repair a torn tendon in his right leg after a late-night fall.
Mrs. Clinton had been scheduled to leave on Saturday morning and a departure later that day may be possible.
"She's concerned about the president," Lattimore said. "Having a trip ahead of her is the last thing on her mind right now."
Her six-nation goodwill mission to Africa includes visits to Senegal, South Africa, Zimbabwe, Tanzania, Uganda and Eritrea. It would be the first lady's ninth solo trip outside the United States.
